intro: Urceolina tenera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a tropical shrub characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of Central and South America. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing capsules. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Urceolina tenera is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
